instructions:
In a small bowl, combine the mustard, sage, thyme, pepper and 1/4 tsp salt. Lightly pound the breasts and
rub the mixture over the chicken, cover and refrigerate for 3 hours.
In a 2 quart saucepan, melt 1 tbsp margarine, add onions, and cook covered over low heat for about 6
minutes or until translucent. Add the cabbage with remaining 1/4 tsp salt, caraway seeds and 1 tbsp vinegar.
Stir and mix well, cover and continue cooking for an additional 15 minutes stirring occasionally. Remove
from heat, set aside and keep warm.
Melt 1/2 tbsp margarine in a non-stick skillet. Add apple pieces and cook over medium heat, about 6
minutes turning until evenly browned. Sprinkle with the sugar and cook 2 minutes. Stir in 1 tbsp vinegar
and remove from skillet and keep warm.
Add the remaining 1 tbsp margarine to the skillet over medium heat. Add the chicken breasts and sauté 1
1/2 minutes on each side or until nicely browned. Reduce heat and cook until done.
Serve the chicken over a bed of cabbage on each plate and top with apples. Serves 2.
ingredients: 1 Granny Smith apple, peeled, cored and cut into 8 wedge slices
name: Chicken With Cabbage And Apples
creator: Ralph Yeager
